member.name: M:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Kernel32.BeginUpdateResource(System.String,System.Boolean)

member.name: M:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Kernel32.UpdateResource(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.UInt16,System.Byte[],System.UInt32)
member.summary: Adds, deletes, or replaces a resource in a portable executable (PE) file. There are some restrictions on resource updates in files that contain Resource Configuration (RC Config) data: language-neutral (LN) files and language-specific resource (.mui) files.
member.param: A module handle returned by the BeginUpdateResource function, referencing the file to be updated.
Pointer to a null-terminated string specifying the resource type to be updated.
Pointer to a null-terminated string specifying the name of the resource to be updated.
Specifies the language identifier of the resource to be updated.
Pointer to the resource data to be inserted into the file indicated by hUpdate.
Specifies the size, in bytes, of the resource data at lpData.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if successful or FALSE otherwise.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Kernel32.EndUpdateResource(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Commits or discards changes made prior to a call to UpdateResource.
member.param: A module handle returned by the BeginUpdateResource function, and used by UpdateResource, referencing the file to be updated.
Specifies whether to write the resource updates to the file. If this parameter is TRUE, no changes are made. If it is FALSE, the changes are made: the resource updates will take effect.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if the function succeeds; FALSE otherwise.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Kernel32.CREATEPROCESS_MANIFEST_RESOURCE_ID
member.summary: CREATEPROCESS_MANIFEST_RESOURCE_ID is used primarily for EXEs. If an executable has a resource of type RT_MANIFEST, ID CREATEPROCESS_MANIFEST_RESOURCE_ID, Windows will create a process default activation context for the process. The process default activation context will be used by all components running in the process. CREATEPROCESS_MANIFEST_RESOURCE_ID can also used by DLLs. When Windows probe for dependencies, if the dll has a resource of type RT_MANIFEST, ID CREATEPROCESS_MANIFEST_RESOURCE_ID, Windows will use that manifest as the dependency.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Kernel32.ISOLATIONAWARE_MANIFEST_RESOURCE_ID
member.summary: ISOLATIONAWARE_MANIFEST_RESOURCE_ID is used primarily for DLLs. It should be used if the dll wants private dependencies other than the process default. For example, if an dll depends on comctl32.dll version 6.0.0.0. It should have a resource of type RT_MANIFEST, ID ISOLATIONAWARE_MANIFEST_RESOURCE_ID to depend on comctl32.dll version 6.0.0.0, so that even if the process executable wants comctl32.dll version 5.1, the dll itself will still use the right version of comctl32.dll.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Kernel32.ISOLATIONAWARE_NOSTATICIMPORT_MANIFEST_RESOURCE_ID
member.summary: When ISOLATION_AWARE_ENABLED is defined, Windows re-defines certain APIs. For example LoadLibraryExW is redefined to IsolationAwareLoadLibraryExW.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Gdi32
member.summary: Gdi32.dll interop functions.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Gdi32.BitmapCompression
member.summary: Bitmap compression options.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Gdi32.BitmapCompression.BI_RGB
member.summary: An uncompressed format.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Gdi32.BitmapCompression.BI_RLE8
member.summary: A run-length encoded (RLE) format for bitmaps with 8 bpp. The compression format is a 2-byte format consisting of a count byte followed by a byte containing a color index. For more information, see Bitmap Compression.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Gdi32.BitmapCompression.BI_RLE4
member.summary: An RLE format for bitmaps with 4 bpp. The compression format is a 2-byte format consisting of a count byte followed by two word-length color indexes. For more information, see Bitmap Compression.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Gdi32.BitmapCompression.BI_BITFIELDS
member.summary: Specifies that the bitmap is not compressed and that the color table consists of three DWORD color masks that specify the red, green, and blue components, respectively, of each pixel. This is valid when used with 16- and 32-bpp bitmaps.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Gdi32.BitmapCompression.BI_JPEG
member.summary: Windows 98/Me, Windows 2000/XP: Indicates that the image is a JPEG image.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Gdi32.BitmapCompression.BI_PNG
member.summary: Windows 98/Me, Windows 2000/XP: Indicates that the image is a PNG image.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Gdi32.BITMAPINFOHEADER
member.summary: A bitmap info header. See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms532290.aspx for more information.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Gdi32.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biSize
member.summary: Bitmap information size.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Gdi32.SetDIBitsToDevice(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Byte[],AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Gdi32.BITMAPINFO@,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Set the pixels in the specified rectangle on the device that is associated with the destination device context using color data from a DIB, JPEG, or PNG image. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd162974(VS.85).aspx
member.param: A handle to the device context.
The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the destination rectangle.
The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the destination rectangle.
The width, in logical units, of the image.
The height, in logical units, of the image.
The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the lower-left corner of the image.
The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the lower-left corner of the image.
The starting scan line in the image.
The number of DIB scan lines contained in the array pointed to by the lpvBits parameter.
A pointer to the color data stored as an array of bytes.
A pointer to a BITMAPINFOHEADER structure that contains information about the DIB.
Indicates whether the bmiColors member of the BITMAPINFOHEADER structure contains explicit red, green, blue (RGB) values or indexes into a palette.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the number of scan lines set. If zero scan lines are set (such as when dwHeight is 0) or the function fails, the function returns zero. If the driver cannot support the JPEG or PNG file image passed to SetDIBitsToDevice, the function will fail and return GDI_ERROR.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Gdi32.SetDIBitsToDevice(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Set the pixels in the specified rectangle on the device that is associated with the destination device context using color data from a DIB, JPEG, or PNG image. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd162974(VS.85).aspx

The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the destination rectangle.

The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the lower-left corner of the image.
The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the lower-left corner of the image.
The starting scan line in the image.
The number of DIB scan lines contained in the array pointed to by the lpvBits parameter.
A pointer to the color data stored as an array of bytes.
A pointer to a BITMAPINFOHEADER structure that contains information about the DIB.
Indicates whether the bmiColors member of the BITMAPINFOHEADER structure contains explicit red, green, blue (RGB) values or indexes into a palette.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the number of scan lines set. If zero scan lines are set (such as when dwHeight is 0) or the function fails, the function returns zero. If the driver cannot support the JPEG or PNG file image passed to SetDIBitsToDevice, the function will fail and return GDI_ERROR.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Gdi32.GetDIBits(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Byte[],AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Gdi32.BITMAPINFO@,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves the bits of the specified compatible bitmap and copies them into a buffer as a DIB using the specified format
member.param: A handle to the device context.
A handle to the bitmap. This must be a compatible bitmap (DDB).
The first scan line to retrieve.
The number of scan lines to retrieve.
A pointer to a buffer to receive the bitmap data.
A pointer to a BITMAPINFO structure that specifies the desired format for the DIB data.
The format of the bmiColors member of the BITMAPINFO structure.
member.returns: If the lpvBits parameter is non-NULL and the function succeeds, the return value is the number of scan lines copied from the bitmap. If the lpvBits parameter is NULL and GetDIBits successfully fills the BITMAPINFO structure, the return value is non-zero. If the function fails, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Gdi32.CreateDIBSection(System.IntPtr,AddinExpress.Projects.Common.Gdi32.BITMAPINFO@,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr@,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Create a DIB that applications can write to directly. The function gives you a pointer to the location of the bitmap bit values. You can supply a handle to a file-mapping object that the function will use to create the bitmap, or you can let the system allocate the memory for the bitmap.
member.param: Handle to a device context.
A pointer to a BITMAPINFO structure that specifies various attributes of the DIB, including the bitmap dimensions and colors.
The type of data contained in the bmiColors array member of the BITMAPINFO structure pointed to by pbmi (either logical palette indexes or literal RGB values).
A pointer to a variable that receives a pointer to the location of the DIB bit values.
A handle to a file-mapping object that the function will use to create the DIB. This parameter can be NULL.
The offset from the beginning of the file-mapping object referenced by hSection where storage for the bitmap bit values is to begin.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the newly created DIB, and *ppvBits points to the bitmap bit values. If the function fails, the return value is NULL, and *ppvBits is NULL.

member.summary: The color table contains literal RGB values.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.StringResource
member.summary: A string, RT_STRING resource. Each string resource block has 16 strings, each represented as an ordered pair (length, text). Length is a WORD that specifies the size, in terms of the number of characters, in the text that follows. Text follows length and contains the string in Unicode without the NULL terminating character. There may be no characters in text, in which case length is zero.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ICONINFO
member.summary: Contains information about an icon or a cursor.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ICONINFO.IsIcon
member.summary: Specifies whether this structure defines an icon or a cursor. A value of TRUE specifies an icon; FALSE specifies a cursor.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ICONINFO.xHotspot
member.summary: Specifies the x-coordinate of a cursor's hot spot. If this structure defines an icon, the hot spot is always in the center of the icon, and this member is ignored.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ICONINFO.yHotspot
member.summary: Specifies the y-coordinate of the cursor's hot spot. If this structure defines an icon, the hot spot is always in the center of the icon, and this member is ignored.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ICONINFO.MaskBitmap
member.summary: Specifies the icon bitmask bitmap.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ICONINFO.ColorBitmap
member.summary: Handle to the icon color bitmap.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.GetDC(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Retrieve a handle to a device context (DC) for the client area of a specified window or for the entire screen.
member.param: A handle to the window whose DC is to be retrieved. If this value is NULL, GetDC retrieves the DC for the entire screen.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the DC for the specified window's client area. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ReleaseDC(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Releases a device context (DC), freeing it for use by other applications.
member.param: A handle to the window whose DC is to be released.
A handle to the DC to be released.
member.returns: The return value indicates whether the DC was released. If the DC was released, the return value is 1. If the DC was not released, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DestroyIcon(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Destroys an icon and frees any memory the icon occupied.
member.param: Handle to the icon to be destroyed.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.CreateIconIndirect(AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ICONINFO@)
member.summary: Creates an icon or cursor from an ICONINFO structure.
member.param: Pointer to an ICONINFO structure the function uses to create the icon or cursor.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the icon or cursor that is created. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DIALOGTEMPLATE
member.summary: The DIALOGTEMPLATE structure defines the dimensions and style of a dialog box. This structure, always the first in a standard template for a dialog box, also specifies the number of controls in the dialog box and therefore specifies the number of subsequent DIALOGITEMTEMPLATE structures in the template.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.WindowStyles
member.summary: Window styles. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms632600(VS.85).aspx

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.WindowStyles.WS_OVERLAPPED
member.summary: Creates an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the WS_TILED style.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.WindowStyles.WS_POPUP
member.summary: Creates a pop-up window. This style cannot be used with the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.WindowStyles.WS_CHILD
member.summary: Creates a child window. A window with this style cannot have a menu bar. This style cannot be used with the WS_POPUP style.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.WindowStyles.WS_MINIMIZE
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially minimized. Same as the WS_ICONIC style.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.WindowStyles.WS_VISIBLE
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially visible.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.WindowStyles.WS_DISABLED
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially disabled. A disabled window cannot receive input from the user.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.WindowStyles.WS_CLIPSIBLINGS
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a WM_PAINT message, the WS_CLIPSIBLINGS style clips all other overlapping child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. If WS_CLIPSIBLINGS is not specified and child windows overlap, it is possible, when drawing within the client area of a child window, to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.WindowStyles.WS_CLIPCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes the area occupied by child windows when drawing occurs within the parent window. This style is used when creating the parent window.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.WindowStyles.WS_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: Creates a window that is initially maximized.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.WindowStyles.WS_CAPTION
member.summary: Creates a window that has a title bar (includes the WS_BORDER style).

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.WindowStyles.WS_BORDER
member.summary: Creates a window that has a thin-line border.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.WindowStyles.WS_DLGFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window that has a border of a style typically used with dialog boxes. A window with this style cannot have a title bar.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.WindowStyles.WS_VSCROLL
member.summary: Creates a window that has a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.WindowStyles.WS_HSCROLL
member.summary: Creates a window that has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.WindowStyles.WS_SYSMENU
member.summary: Creates a window that has a window menu on its title bar. The WS_CAPTION style must also be specified.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.WindowStyles.WS_THICKFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window that has a sizing border. Same as the WS_SIZEBOX style.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.WindowStyles.WS_GROUP
member.summary: Specifies the first control of a group of controls. The group consists of this first control and all controls defined after it, up to the next control with the WS_GROUP style. The first control in each group usually has the WS_TABSTOP style so that the user can move from group to group. The user can subsequently change the keyboard focus from one control in the group to the next control in the group by using the direction keys.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.WindowStyles.WS_TABSTOP
member.summary: Specifies a control that can receive the keyboard focus when the user presses the TAB key. Pressing the TAB key changes the keyboard focus to the next control with the WS_TABSTOP style.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogStyles
member.summary: Dialog styles. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms644994(VS.85).aspx

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogStyles.DS_ABSALIGN
member.summary: Specifying this style in the dialog template tells Windows that the dtX and dtY values of the DIALOGTEMPLATE struct are relative to the screen origin, not the owner of the dialog box.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogStyles.DS_SYSMODAL
member.summary: Create a dialog box with the WS_EX_TOPMOST flag. This flag cannot be combined with the DS_CONTROL style. This flag is obsolete and is included for compatibility with 16-bit versions of Windows.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogStyles.DS_LOCALEDIT
member.summary: Applies to 16-bit applications only. This style directs edit controls in the dialog box to allocate memory from the application data segment. Otherwise, edit controls allocate storage from a global memory object.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogStyles.DS_SETFONT
member.summary: Indicates that the header of the dialog box template contains additional data specifying the font to use for text in the client area and controls of the dialog box.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogStyles.DS_MODALFRAME
member.summary: Creates a dialog box with a modal dialog-box frame that can be combined with a title bar and window menu by specifying the WS_CAPTION and WS_SYSMENU styles.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogStyles.DS_NOIDLEMSG
member.summary: Suppresses WM_ENTERIDLE messages that the system would otherwise send to the owner of the dialog box while the dialog box is displayed.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogStyles.DS_SETFOREGROUND
member.summary: Causes the system to use the SetForegroundWindow function to bring the dialog box to the foreground.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogStyles.DS_3DLOOK
member.summary: Gives the dialog box a nonbold font and draws three-dimensional borders around control windows in the dialog box.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogStyles.DS_FIXEDSYS
member.summary: Causes the dialog box to use the SYSTEM_FIXED_FONT instead of the default SYSTEM_FONT. This is a monospace font compatible with the System font in 16-bit versions of Windows earlier than 3.0.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogStyles.DS_NOFAILCREATE
member.summary: Creates the dialog box even if errors occur â€” for example, if a child window cannot be created or if the system cannot create a special data segment for an edit control.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogStyles.DS_CONTROL
member.summary: Creates a dialog box that works well as a child window of another dialog box, much like a page in a property sheet. This style allows the user to tab among the control windows of a child dialog box, use its accelerator keys, and so on.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogStyles.DS_CENTER
member.summary: Centers the dialog box in the working area; that is, the area not obscured by the tray.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogStyles.DS_CENTERMOUSE
member.summary: Centers the dialog box on the mouse cursor.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogStyles.DS_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: Includes a question mark in the title bar of the dialog box. When the user clicks the question mark, the cursor changes to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a control in the dialog box, the control receives a WM_HELP message. The control should pass the message to the dialog box procedure, which should call the function using the HELP_WM_HELP command. The help application displays a pop-up window that typically contains help for the control.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogStyles.DS_SHELLFONT
member.summary: Indicates that the dialog box should use the system font.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles
member.summary: Extended dialog styles.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_DLGMODALFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window that has a double border; the window can, optionally, be created with a title bar by specifying the WS_CAPTION style in the dwStyle parameter.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_NOPARENTNOTIFY
member.summary: Specifies that a child window created with this style does not send the WM_PARENTNOTIFY message to its parent window when it is created or destroyed.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_TOPMOST
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style should be placed above all non-topmost windows and should stay above them, even when the window is deactivated. To add or remove this style, use the SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_ACCEPTFILES
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style accepts drag-drop files.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style should not be painted until siblings beneath the window (that were created by the same thread) have been painted. The window appears transparent because the bits of underlying sibling windows have already been painted.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_MDICHILD
member.summary: Creates a multiple-document interface (MDI) child window.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_TOOLWINDOW
member.summary: Creates a tool window; that is, a window intended to be used as a floating toolbar. A tool window has a title bar that is shorter than a normal title bar, and the window title is drawn using a smaller font. A tool window does not appear in the taskbar or in the dialog that appears when the user presses ALT+TAB. If a tool window has a system menu, its icon is not displayed on the title bar. However, you can display the system menu by right-clicking or by typing ALT+SPACE.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE
member.summary: Specifies that a window has a border with a raised edge.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE
member.summary: Specifies that a window has a border with a sunken edge.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: Includes a question mark in the title bar of the window. When the user clicks the question mark, the cursor changes to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a child window, the child receives a WM_HELP message. The child window should pass the message to the parent window procedure, which should call the WinHelp function using the HELP_WM_HELP command. The Help application displays a pop-up window that typically contains help for the child window.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_RIGHT
member.summary: The window has generic "right-aligned" properties. This depends on the window class. This style has an effect only if the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment; otherwise, the style is ignored. Using the WS_EX_RIGHT style for static or edit controls has the same effect as using the SS_RIGHT or ES_RIGHT style, respectively. Using this style with button controls has the same effect as using BS_RIGHT and BS_RIGHTBUTTON styles.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_LEFT
member.summary: Creates a window that has generic left-aligned properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_RTLREADING
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment, the window text is displayed using right-to-left reading-order properties. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_LTRREADING
member.summary: The window text is displayed using left-to-right reading-order properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_LEFTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading order alignment, the vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the left of the client area. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_RIGHTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: Vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the right of the client area. This is the default.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT
member.summary: The window itself contains child windows that should take part in dialog box navigation. If this style is specified, the dialog manager recurses into children of this window when performing navigation operations such as handling the TAB key, an arrow key, or a keyboard mnemonic.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_STATICEDGE
member.summary: Creates a window with a three-dimensional border style intended to be used for items that do not accept user input.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_APPWINDOW
member.summary: Forces a top-level window onto the taskbar when the window is visible.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: Combines the WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE and WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE styles.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_PALETTEWINDOW
member.summary: Combines the WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE, WS_EX_TOOLWINDOW, and WS_EX_TOPMOST styles.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_LAYERED
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: Creates a layered window. Note that this cannot be used for child windows. Also, this cannot be used if the window has a class style of either CS_OWNDC or CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_NOINHERITLAYOUT
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: A window created with this style does not pass its window layout to its child windows.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_LAYOUTRTL
member.summary: Arabic and Hebrew versions of Windows 98/Me, Windows 2000/XP: Creates a window whose horizontal origin is on the right edge. Increasing horizontal values advance to the left.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_COMPOSITED
member.summary: Windows XP: Paints all descendants of a window in bottom-to-top painting order using double-buffering. For more information, see Remarks. This cannot be used if the window has a class style of either CS_OWNDC or CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ExtendedDialogStyles.WS_EX_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: A top-level window created with this style does not become the foreground window when the user clicks it. The system does not bring this window to the foreground when the user minimizes or closes the foreground window.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogItemClass
member.summary: Possible DIALOGEXITEMTEMPLATE WindowClass ordinals.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogItemClass.Button
member.summary: A button.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogItemClass.Edit
member.summary: An edit box.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogItemClass.Static
member.summary: A static control.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogItemClass.ListBox
member.summary: A list box.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogItemClass.ScrollBar
member.summary: A scroll bar.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.DialogItemClass.ComboBox
member.summary: A combo box.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles
member.summary: Static control styles. A static control specifies the STATIC class, appropriate window style constants, and a combination of the following static control styles. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb760773(VS.85).aspx

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_LEFT
member.summary: Specifies a simple rectangle and left-aligns the text in the rectangle. The text is formatted before it is displayed. Words that extend past the end of a line are automatically wrapped to the beginning of the next left-aligned line. Words that are longer than the width of the control are truncated.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_CENTER
member.summary: Specifies a simple rectangle and centers the text in the rectangle. The text is formatted before it is displayed. Words that extend past the end of a line are automatically wrapped to the beginning of the next centered line. Words that are longer than the width of the control are truncated.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_RIGHT
member.summary: Specifies a simple rectangle and right-aligns the text in the rectangle. The text is formatted before it is displayed. Words that extend past the end of a line are automatically wrapped to the beginning of the next right-aligned line. Words that are longer than the width of the control are truncated.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_ICON
member.summary: Specifies an icon to be displayed in the dialog box. If the control is created as part of a dialog box, the text is the name of an icon (not a filename) defined elsewhere in the resource file. If the control is created via CreateWindow or a related function, the text is the name of an icon (not a filename) defined in the resource file associated with the module specified by the hInstance parameter to CreateWindow. The icon can be an animated cursor.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_BLACKRECT
member.summary: Specifies a rectangle filled with the current window frame color. This color is black in the default color scheme.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_GRAYRECT
member.summary: Specifies a rectangle filled with the current screen background color. This color is gray in the default color scheme.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_WHITERECT
member.summary: Specifies a rectangle filled with the current window background color. This color is white in the default color scheme.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_BLACKFRAME
member.summary: Specifies a box with a frame drawn in the same color as the window frames. This color is black in the default color scheme.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_GRAYFRAME
member.summary: Specifies a box with a frame drawn with the same color as the screen background (desktop). This color is gray in the default color scheme.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_WHITEFRAME
member.summary: Specifies a box with a frame drawn with the same color as the window background. This color is white in the default color scheme.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_SIMPLE
member.summary: Specifies a simple rectangle and displays a single line of left-aligned text in the rectangle. The text line cannot be shortened or altered in any way. Also, if the control is disabled, the control does not gray its text.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_LEFTNOWORDWRAP
member.summary: Specifies a simple rectangle and left-aligns the text in the rectangle. Tabs are expanded, but words are not wrapped. Text that extends past the end of a line is clipped.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_OWNERDRAW
member.summary: Specifies that the owner of the static control is responsible for drawing the control. The owner window receives a WM_DRAWITEM message whenever the control needs to be drawn.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_BITMAP
member.summary: Specifies that a bitmap is to be displayed in the static control. The text is the name of a bitmap (not a filename) defined elsewhere in the resource file. The style ignores the nWidth and nHeight parameters; the control automatically sizes itself to accommodate the bitmap.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_ENHMETAFILE
member.summary: Specifies that an enhanced metafile is to be displayed in the static control. The text is the name of a metafile. An enhanced metafile static control has a fixed size; the metafile is scaled to fit the static control's client area.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_ETCHEDHORZ
member.summary: Draws the top and bottom edges of the static control using the EDGE_ETCHED edge style.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_ETCHEDVERT
member.summary: Draws the left and right edges of the static control using the EDGE_ETCHED edge style.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_ETCHEDFRAME
member.summary: Draws the frame of the static control using the EDGE_ETCHED edge style.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_TYPEMASK
member.summary: Windows 2000: A composite style bit that results from using the OR operator on SS_* style bits. Can be used to mask out valid SS_* bits from a given bitmask. Note that this is out of date and does not correctly include all valid styles. Thus, you should not use this style.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_REALSIZECONTROL
member.summary: Windows XP or later: Adjusts the bitmap to fit the size of the static control. For example, changing the locale can change the system font, and thus controls might be resized. If a static control had a bitmap, the bitmap would no longer fit the control. This style bit dictates automatic redimensioning of bitmaps to fit their controls.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_NOPREFIX
member.summary: Prevents interpretation of any ampersand characters in the control's text as accelerator prefix characters. These are displayed with the ampersand removed and the next character in the string underlined. This static control style may be included with any of the defined static controls. You can combine SS_NOPREFIX with other styles. This can be useful when filenames or other strings that may contain an ampersand must be displayed in a static control in a dialog box.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_NOTIFY
member.summary: Sends the parent window STN_CLICKED, STN_DBLCLK, STN_DISABLE, and STN_ENABLE notification messages when the user clicks or double-clicks the control.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_CENTERIMAGE
member.summary: Specifies that a bitmap is centered in the static control that contains it. The control is not resized, so that a bitmap too large for the control will be clipped. If the static control contains a single line of text, the text is centered vertically in the client area of the control.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_RIGHTJUST
member.summary: Specifies that the lower right corner of a static control with the SS_BITMAP or SS_ICON style is to remain fixed when the control is resized. Only the top and left sides are adjusted to accommodate a new bitmap or icon.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_REALSIZEIMAGE
member.summary: Specifies that the actual resource width is used and the icon is loaded using LoadImage. SS_REALSIZEIMAGE is always used in conjunction with SS_ICON.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_SUNKEN
member.summary: Draws a half-sunken border around a static control.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_EDITCONTROL
member.summary: Microsoft Windows 2000: Specifies that the static control duplicates the text-displaying characteristics of a multiline edit control. Specifically, the average character width is calculated in the same manner as with an edit control, and the function does not display a partially visible last line.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_ENDELLIPSIS
member.summary: Microsoft Windows NT or later: If the end of a string does not fit in the rectangle, it is truncated and ellipses are added. If a word that is not at the end of the string goes beyond the limits of the rectangle, it is truncated without ellipses. Using this style will force the controlÂ’s text to be on one line with no word wrap. Compare with SS_PATHELLIPSIS and SS_WORDELLIPSIS.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_PATHELLIPSIS
member.summary: Windows NT or later: Replaces characters in the middle of the string with ellipses so that the result fits in the specified rectangle. If the string contains backslash (\) characters, SS_PATHELLIPSIS preserves as much as possible of the text after the last backslash. Using this style will force the controlÂ’s text to be on one line with no word wrap. Compare with SS_ENDELLIPSIS and SS_WORDELLIPSIS.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.StaticControlStyles.SS_WORDELLIPSIS
member.summary: Windows NT or later: Truncates any word that does not fit in the rectangle and adds ellipses. Using this style will force the controlÂ’s text to be on one line with no word wrap.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles
member.summary: Push button styles. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb775951(VS.85).aspx

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_PUSHBUTTON
member.summary: Creates a push button that posts a WM_COMMAND message to the owner window when the user selects the button.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_DEFPUSHBUTTON
member.summary: Creates a push button that behaves like a BS_PUSHBUTTON style button, but has a distinct appearance. If the button is in a dialog box, the user can select the button by pressing the ENTER key, even when the button does not have the input focus. This style is useful for enabling the user to quickly select the most likely (default) option.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_CHECKBOX
member.summary: Creates a small, empty check box with text. By default, the text is displayed to the right of the check box. To display the text to the left of the check box, combine this flag with the BS_LEFTTEXT style (or with the equivalent BS_RIGHTBUTTON style).

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_AUTOCHECKBOX
member.summary: Creates a button that is the same as a check box, except that the check state automatically toggles between checked and cleared each time the user selects the check box.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_RADIOBUTTON
member.summary: Creates a small circle with text. By default, the text is displayed to the right of the circle. To display the text to the left of the circle, combine this flag with the BS_LEFTTEXT style (or with the equivalent BS_RIGHTBUTTON style). Use radio buttons for groups of related, but mutually exclusive choices.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_3STATE
member.summary: Creates a button that is the same as a check box, except that the box can be grayed as well as checked or cleared. Use the grayed state to show that the state of the check box is not determined.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_AUTO3STATE
member.summary: Creates a button that is the same as a three-state check box, except that the box changes its state when the user selects it. The state cycles through checked, indeterminate, and cleared.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_GROUPBOX
member.summary: Creates a rectangle in which other controls can be grouped. Any text associated with this style is displayed in the rectangle's upper left corner.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_USERBUTTON
member.summary: Obsolete, but provided for compatibility with 16-bit versions of Windows. Applications should use BS_OWNERDRAW instead.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_AUTORADIOBUTTON
member.summary: Creates a button that is the same as a radio button, except that when the user selects it, the system automatically sets the button's check state to checked and automatically sets the check state for all other buttons in the same group to cleared.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_OWNERDRAW
member.summary: Creates an owner-drawn button. The owner window receives a WM_DRAWITEM message when a visual aspect of the button has changed. Do not combine the BS_OWNERDRAW style with any other button styles.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_TYPEMASK
member.summary: Microsoft Windows 2000: A composite style bit that results from using the OR operator on BS_* style bits. It can be used to mask out valid BS_* bits from a given bitmask.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_LEFTTEXT
member.summary: Places text on the left side of the radio button or check box when combined with a radio button or check box style. Same as the BS_RIGHTBUTTON style.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_TEXT
member.summary: Specifies that the button displays text.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_ICON
member.summary: Specifies that the button displays an icon.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_BITMAP
member.summary: Specifies that the button displays a bitmap. See the Remarks section for its interaction with BS_ICON.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_LEFT
member.summary: Left-justifies the text in the button rectangle. However, if the button is a check box or radio button that does not have the BS_RIGHTBUTTON style, the text is left justified on the right side of the check box or radio button.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_RIGHT
member.summary: Right-justifies text in the button rectangle. However, if the button is a check box or radio button that does not have the BS_RIGHTBUTTON style, the text is right justified on the right side of the check box or radio button.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_CENTER
member.summary: Centers text horizontally in the button rectangle.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_TOP
member.summary: Places text at the top of the button rectangle.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_BOTTOM
member.summary: Places text at the bottom of the button rectangle.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_VCENTER
member.summary: Places text in the middle (vertically) of the button rectangle.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_PUSHLIKE
member.summary: Makes a button (such as a check box, three-state check box, or radio button) look and act like a push button. The button looks raised when it isn't pushed or checked, and sunken when it is pushed or checked.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_MULTILINE
member.summary: Wraps the button text to multiple lines if the text string is too long to fit on a single line in the button rectangle.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_NOTIFY
member.summary: Enables a button to send BN_KILLFOCUS and BN_SETFOCUS notification messages to its parent window.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_FLAT
member.summary: Specifies that the button is two-dimensional; it does not use the default shading to create a 3-D image.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_DEFSPLITBUTTON
member.summary: Microsoft Windows Vista and Version 6.00. Creates a split button that behaves like a BS_PUSHBUTTON style button, but also has a distinctive appearance. If the split button is in a dialog box, the user can select the split button by pressing the ENTER key, even when the split button does not have the input focus. This style is useful for enabling the user to quickly select the most likely (default) option.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_COMMANDLINK
member.summary: Microsoft Windows Vista and Version 6.00. Creates a command link button that behaves like a BS_PUSHBUTTON style button, but the command link button has a green arrow on the left pointing to the button text. A caption for the button text can be set by sending the BCM_SETNOTE message to the button.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.ButtonControlStyles.BS_DEFCOMMANDLINK
member.summary: Microsoft Windows Vista and Version 6.00. Creates a command link button that behaves like a BS_PUSHBUTTON style button. If the button is in a dialog box, the user can select the command link button by pressing the ENTER key, even when the command link button does not have the input focus. This style is useful for enabling the user to quickly select the most likely (default) option.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.EditControlStyles
member.summary: Edit control styles. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb775464(VS.85).aspx

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.EditControlStyles.ES_LEFT
member.summary: Aligns text with the left margin.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.EditControlStyles.ES_CENTER
member.summary: Windows 98/Me, Windows 2000/XP: Centers text in a single-line or multiline edit control. Windows 95, Windows NT 4.0 and earlier: Centers text in a multiline edit control.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.EditControlStyles.ES_RIGHT
member.summary: Windows 98/Me, Windows 2000/XP: Right-aligns text in a single-line or multiline edit control. Windows 95, Windows NT 4.0 and earlier: Right aligns text in a multiline edit control.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.EditControlStyles.ES_MULTILINE
member.summary: Designates a multiline edit control. The default is single-line edit control.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.EditControlStyles.ES_UPPERCASE
member.summary: Converts all characters to uppercase as they are typed into the edit control.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.EditControlStyles.ES_LOWERCASE
member.summary: Converts all characters to lowercase as they are typed into the edit control.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.EditControlStyles.ES_PASSWORD
member.summary: Displays an asterisk (*) for each character typed into the edit control. This style is valid only for single-line edit controls.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.EditControlStyles.ES_AUTOVSCROLL
member.summary: Automatically scrolls text up one page when the user presses the ENTER key on the last line.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.EditControlStyles.ES_AUTOHSCROLL
member.summary: Automatically scrolls text to the right by 10 characters when the user types a character at the end of the line. When the user presses the ENTER key, the control scrolls all text back to position zero.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.EditControlStyles.ES_NOHIDESEL
member.summary: Negates the default behavior for an edit control.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.EditControlStyles.ES_OEMCONVERT
member.summary: Converts text entered in the edit control.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.EditControlStyles.ES_READONLY
member.summary: Prevents the user from typing or editing text in the edit control.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.EditControlStyles.ES_WANTRETURN
member.summary: Specifies that a carriage return be inserted when the user presses the ENTER key while entering text into a multiline edit control in a dialog box. If you do not specify this style, pressing the ENTER key has the same effect as pressing the dialog box's default push button. This style has no effect on a single-line edit control.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.EditControlStyles.ES_NUMBER
member.summary: Allows only digits to be entered into the edit control.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MENUTEMPLATE
member.summary: Defines the header for a menu template. A complete menu template consists of a header and one or more menu item lists.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MENUTEMPLATE.wVersion
member.summary: Specifies the version number. This member must be zero.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MENUTEMPLATE.wOffset
member.summary: Specifies the offset, in bytes, from the end of the header. The menu item list begins at this offset. Usually, this member is zero, and the menu item list follows immediately after the header.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MENUITEMTEMPLATE
member.summary: Defines a menu item in a menu template.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MENUITEMTEMPLATE.mtOption
member.summary: Specifies one or more of the following predefined menu options that control the appearance of the menu item. TODO

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MENUEXTEMPLATE
member.summary: Defines the header for an extended menu template.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MENUEXTEMPLATE.wVersion
member.summary: Template version number. This member must be 1 for extended menu templates.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MENUEXTEMPLATE.wOffset
member.summary: Offset of the first MENUEXITEMTEMPLATE structure, relative to the end of this structure member. If the first item definition immediately follows the dwHelpId member, this member should be 4.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MENUEXITEMTEMPLATE
member.summary: Drop-down menu or submenu item.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MENUEXITEMTEMPLATE.dwType
member.summary: Menu item type. This member can be a combination of the type (beginning with MFT) values listed with the MENUITEMINFO structure.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MENUEXITEMTEMPLATE.dwState
member.summary: Menu item state. This member can be a combination of the state (beginning with MFS) values listed with the MENUITEMINFO structure.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MENUEXITEMTEMPLATE.dwMenuId
member.summary: Menu item identifier. This is an application-defined value that identifies the menu item.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MENUEXITEMTEMPLATE.bResInfo
member.summary: Value specifying whether the menu item is the last item in the menu bar, drop-down menu, submenu, or shortcut menu and whether it is an item that opens a drop-down menu or submenu.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MenuFlags
member.summary: Specifies one or more of the following predefined menu options that control the appearance of the menu item.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MenuFlags.MF_GRAYED
member.summary: Indicates that the menu item is initially inactive and drawn with a gray effect.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MenuFlags.MF_CHECKED
member.summary: Indicates that the menu item has a check mark next to it.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MenuFlags.MF_OWNERDRAW
member.summary: Indicates that the owner window of the menu is responsible for drawing all visual aspects of the menu item, including highlighted, selected, and inactive states. This option is not valid for an item in a menu bar.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MenuFlags.MF_POPUP
member.summary: Indicates that the item is one that opens a drop-down menu or submenu.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MenuFlags.MF_MENUBARBREAK
member.summary: Indicates that the menu item is placed in a new column. The old and new columns are separated by a bar.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MenuFlags.MF_MENUBREAK
member.summary: Indicates that the menu item is placed in a new column.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MenuFlags.MF_HELP
member.summary: Indicates that the menu item has a vertical separator to its left.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MenuResourceType
member.summary: Specifies whether the menu item is the last item in the menu bar, drop-down menu, submenu, or shortcut menu and whether it is an item that opens a drop-down menu or submenu. This member can be zero or more of these values.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MenuResourceType.Last
member.summary: Defines the last menu item in the menu bar, drop-down menu, submenu, or shortcut menu.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.MenuResourceType.Sub
member.summary: Defines a item that opens a drop-down menu or submenu. Subsequent structures define menu items in the corresponding drop-down menu or submenu.

member.summary: Virtual key.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.AcceleratorVirtualKey.NOINVERT
member.summary: Specifies that no top-level menu item is highlighted when the accelerator is used. This is useful when defining accelerators for actions such as scrolling that do not correspond to a menu item. If NOINVERT is omitted, a top-level menu item will be highlighted (if possible) when the accelerator is used.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.AcceleratorVirtualKey.SHIFT
member.summary: Causes the accelerator to be activated only if the SHIFT key is down. Applies only to virtual keys.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.AcceleratorVirtualKey.CONTROL
member.summary: Causes the accelerator to be activated only if the CONTROL key is down. Applies only to virtual keys.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.AcceleratorVirtualKey.ALT
member.summary: Causes the accelerator to be activated only if the ALT key is down. Applies only to virtual keys.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY
member.summary: Contains information about an individual font in a font resource group.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfVersion
member.summary: Specifies a user-defined version number for the resource data that tools can use to read and write resource files.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfSize
member.summary: Specifies the size of the file, in bytes.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfCopyright
member.summary: Contains a 60-character string with the font supplier's copyright information.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfType
member.summary: Specifies the type of font file.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfPoints
member.summary: Specifies the point size at which this character set looks best.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfVertRes
member.summary: Specifies the vertical resolution, in dots per inch, at which this character set was digitized.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfHorizRes
member.summary: Specifies the horizontal resolution, in dots per inch, at which this character set was digitized.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfAscent
member.summary: Specifies the distance from the top of a character definition cell to the baseline of the typographical font.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfInternalLeading
member.summary: Specifies the amount of leading inside the bounds set by the dfPixHeight member. Accent marks and other diacritical characters can occur in this area.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfExternalLeading
member.summary: Specifies the amount of extra leading that the application adds between rows.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfItalic
member.summary: Specifies an italic font if not equal to zero.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfUnderline
member.summary: Specifies an underlined font if not equal to zero.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfStrikeOut
member.summary: Specifies a strikeout font if not equal to zero.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfWeight
member.summary: Specifies the weight of the font in the range 0 through 1000. For example, 400 is roman and 700 is bold. If this value is zero, a default weight is used.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfCharSet
member.summary: Specifies the character set of the font.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfPixWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of the grid on which a vector font was digitized. For raster fonts, if the member is not equal to zero, it represents the width for all the characters in the bitmap. If the member is equal to zero, the font has variable-width characters.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfPixHeight
member.summary: Specifies the height of the character bitmap for raster fonts or the height of the grid on which a vector font was digitized.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfPitchAndFamily
member.summary: Specifies the pitch and the family of the font.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfAvgWidth
member.summary: Specifies the average width of characters in the font (generally defined as the width of the letter x). This value does not include the overhang required for bold or italic characters.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfMaxWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of the widest character in the font.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfFirstChar
member.summary: Specifies the first character code defined in the font.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfLastChar
member.summary: Specifies the last character code defined in the font.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfDefaultChar
member.summary: Specifies the character to substitute for characters not in the font.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfBreakChar
member.summary: Specifies the character that will be used to define word breaks for text justification.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfWidthBytes
member.summary: Specifies the number of bytes in each row of the bitmap. This value is always even so that the rows start on word boundaries. For vector fonts, this member has no meaning.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfDevice
member.summary: Specifies the offset in the file to a null-terminated string that specifies a device name. For a generic font, this value is zero.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfFace
member.summary: Specifies the offset in the file to a null-terminated string that names the typeface.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.Projects.Common.User32.FONTDIRENTRY.dfReserved
member.summary: This member is reserved.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXAddinModule.StartFromScratch
member.summary:
Setting this property to a value of the ADXRibbons type will do the following:
Hide all of the main top-level built-in tabs (but not contextual tabsets)
Hide the content of the Quick Access Toolbar
Enable the add-in to add its own buttons to the Quick Access Toolbar (this is normally disallowed)
Hide all the commands on the Office Menu except for New, Open, and Save
member.remarks: You cannot customize the Quick Access Toolbar if the value of this property is False.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXAddinModule.Namespace
member.summary: Specifies the shared namespace for the add-in.
member.remarks:
When this property is set to a non-empty string, Add-in Express adds two xmlns attributes to the customUI tag in the resulting Xml markup:
xmlns:default="%ProgId of your add-in, see the ProgID attribute of the AddinModule class%",
xmlns:shared="%the value of the AddinModule.Namespace property%".
Originally, all the Ribbon controls are located in the default namespace (id="%Ribbon control's id%" or idQ="default:%Ribbon control's id%") and you have full control over them via the callbacks provided by Add-in Express. When you specify the Namespace property, Add-in Express changes the markup to use idQ's instead of id's.

member.summary: Returns or sets the ADXCommandBar object on which the command bar control is located.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXBuiltInControl.DisableStandardAction
member.summary: True if the standard action of the built-in command bar control is disabled.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXBuiltInControl.Id
member.summary: Returns or sets an integer that specifies the built-in control.
member.remarks: A control's ID determines the built-in action for that control. The value of the Id property for all custom controls is 1.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXBuiltInControl.ControlTag
member.summary: Returns or sets a string value that uniquely identifies the command bar control.
member.remarks: Add-in Express relies on this value. Please don't change it if don't understand the consequences.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXBuiltInControl.IsConnected
member.summary: True if the built-in control is connected.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXBuiltInControl.ControlObj
member.summary: Returns or sets the COM object connected to the current instance of the class.
member.remarks:
Add-in Express relies on the state of the COM object provided in this class member. That's why you must never release it. On the contrary, you must release every COM object obtained from this COM object.
To release a COM object, you use the ReleaseComObject method of the Marshal class located in the System.Runtime.InteropServices namespace.

member.param: The Add-in module the control belongs to.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXOlBarShortcutCollection.Add(System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new ADXOlBarShortcut with the specified target, name, and path to the icon file, and adds it to the collection.
member.remarks:
The Target type depends on the shortcut type. If the type is MAPIFolder (Folder in Outlook 2007), the shortcut represents a Microsoft Outlook folder. If the type is a String, the shortcut represents a file-system path or a URL.
The OnError event occurs in the appropriate ADXAddinModule if the ADXOlBarShortcut cannot be created or added.
member.param: The target of the shortcut being created.
The name of the shortcut being created.
The path to the icon of the shortcut being created.
member.returns: The existing or a newly created ADXOlBarShortcut.

member.remarks: Connects to the command bar if the CommandBarName property is equal to the name of an existing command bar. Otherwise, creates a new command bar.

member.summary: Makes the new command bar temporary.
member.remarks: Temporary command bars are deleted when the host application is closed.

member.summary: Shows / hides the command bar.

member.summary: The description of the command bar.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXCommandBar.UseForRibbon
member.summary: True if the command bar will be shown in the Ribbon UI.
member.remarks: The command bar will be shown on the Add-ins Ribbon tab.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXCommandBar.AdaptiveMenu
member.summary: True if the individual menu (it's a command bar, remember) is enabled to use adaptive menus.
member.remarks:
This property checks or unchecks the check box control for the option to show an individual menu as full or personalized. Only recently used submenus show up in a menu if this property is set to True. All submenus show up if this property is set to False.
This property works only when the command bar (say, menu "File") is the adxMsoBarTypePopup.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXCommandBar.BuiltIn
member.summary: Returns True if the command bar is a built-in command bar of the host application.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXCommandBar.CommandBarNameLocal
member.summary: If the command bar is a built-in one, returns its name as it's displayed in the language version of the host application, otherwise returns or sets the name of the custom command bar.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXCommandBar.Context
member.summary: Returns or sets a string that determines where the command bar will be saved. The string is defined and interpreted by the application.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXCommandBar.Height
member.summary: The height (in pixels) of the command bar.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXCommandBar.Index
member.summary: Returns the index of the command bar in the CommandBars collection of the host application.

member.name: E:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXExcelAppEvents.CommandBarsUpdate
member.summary: Occurs when any change is made to a command bar.
member.remarks: The event is triggered by any change to a command bar or command bar control or any change to the state of a command bar or command bar control. These changes can occur due to a text or cell selection, for example. Since a large number of OnUpdate events can occur during normal usage, developers should exercise caution when using this event. It is strongly recommended that this event be used primarily for checking that a custom command bar has been added or removed by a COM add-in.

member.summary: The unicode name of the corresponding custom function in the XllContainer class.

member.summary: The function description as it will be shown in Excel UI.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXExcelFunctionDescriptor.HelpTopicId
member.summary: The ID of the help topic associated with the function.
member.remarks: The ADXXLLModule.HeloFile property combined with the HelpTopicId property creates a reference to the Help file (.chm or .hlp) to display when the user clicks the Help button (when your custom function is displayed). Can be in the form filepath!HelpTopicId or http://address/path_to_file_in_site!0. Both parts before and after the "!" are required. HelpTopicId must not contain single quotes, and will be converted by Excel to an unsigned integer 4 bytes long, in decimal form. When using the URL form, Excel opens only the referenced help file.

member.summary: If True, the function is not visible in the 'Insert Function' dialog in Excel.

member.summary: If True, Excel can call the function simultaneously on multiple threads.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXExcelSheetModule.PivotTableWizard(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a new PivotTable report. This method doesnâ€™t display the PivotTable Wizard. This method isnâ€™t available for OLE DB data sources. Use the Add method to add a PivotTable cache, and then create a PivotTable report based on the cache.
member.param: An XlPivotTableSourceType value that represents the source of the report data. If you specify this argument, you must also specify SourceData. If SourceType and SourceData are omitted, Microsoft Excel assumes that the source type is xlDatabase, and the source data comes from the named range "Database." If this named range doesnâ€™t exist, Microsoft Excel uses the current region if the current selection is in a range of more than 10 cells that contain data. If this isnâ€™t true, this method will fail.

The data for the new report. Can be a Range object, an array of ranges, or a text constant that represents the name of another report. For an external database, SourceData is an array of strings containing the SQL query string, where each element is up to 255 characters in length. You should use the Connection argument to specify the ODBC connection string. For compatibility with earlier versions of Excel, SourceData can be a two-element array. The first element is the connection string specifying the ODBC source for the data. The second element is the SQL query string used to get the data. If you specify SourceData, you must also specify SourceType. If the active cell is inside the SourceData range, you must specify TableDestination as well.
A Range object specifying where the report should be placed on the worksheet. If this argument is omitted, the report is placed at the active cell.
A string that specifies the name of the new report.
True to show grand totals for rows in the report.
True to show grand totals for columns in the report.
True to save data with the report. False to save only the report definition.
True to have Microsoft Excel automatically format the report when itâ€™s refreshed or when fields are moved.
Valid only if SourceType is xlConsolidation.True to have Microsoft Excel create a page field for the consolidation. If AutoPage is False, you must create the page field or fields.
Not used by Microsoft Excel.
True to have Excel perform queries for the report asynchronously (in the background). The default value is False.
True to optimize the PivotTable cache when it's constructed. The default value is False.
The order in which page fields are added to the PivotTable reportâ€™s layout. Can be one of the following XlOrder constants: xlDownThenOver or xlOverThenDown. The default value is xlDownThenOver.
The number of page fields in each column or row in the PivotTable report. The default value is 0 (zero).

True to create a PivotTable cache that contains all records from the external database; this cache can be very large. If ReadData is False, you can set some of the fields asserver-based page fields before the data is actually read.
A string that contains ODBC settings that allow Excel to connect to an ODBC data source.

member.summary: Protects a worksheet so that it cannot be modified.
member.param: A string that specifies a case-sensitive password for the worksheet or workbook. If this argument is omitted, you can unprotect the worksheet or workbook without using a password. Otherwise, you must specify the password to unprotect the worksheet or workbook. If you forget the password, you cannot unprotect the worksheet or workbook.
True to protect shapes. The default value is True.
True to protect contents. For a chart, this protects the entire chart. For a worksheet, this protects the locked cells. The default value is True.
True to protect scenarios. This argument is valid only for worksheets. The default value is True.
True to protect the user interface, but not macros. If this argument is omitted, protection applies both to macros and to the user interface.

True to display a message when the file is opened, recommending that the file be opened as read-only.
True to create a backup file.
True to add this workbook to the list of recently used files. The default value is False.
Not used in U. S. Microsoft Excel.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXOutlookItemsEvents
member.summary: Represents a set of business rules to be applied to the events of the Items collection of a given Outlook folder and its sub-folders (optional).
member.remarks: The Items collection is provided by the MAPIFolder class (also Folder in Outlook 2007+). It represents items of the current folder and provides a number of events that occur when an item is added to or removed from the collection. To use the ADXOutlookItemsEvents class, you must add a descendant class to your add-in project (see the Add New Item dialog). To connect to the events of the Items collection of a given folder, you create an instance of the descendant class, and invoke its ConnectTo method. This method accepts several parameters, one of which is of the MAPIFolder type. The other parameter specifies who will release the COM object corresponding to the Items collection. If it is set to true, the descendant class will release the COM object when disconnected from events. If the second parameter is false, the developer is responsible for releasing the COM object. There are overloaded variants of the ConnectTo method that allow connecting to the events of the Items collection of all sub-folders of the specified folder. To disconnect from events, you invoke the RemoveConnection method of the descendant class.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXOutlookItemsEvents.#ctor(AddinExpress.MSO.ADXAddinModule)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An ADXAddinModule which supplies events for the class.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXOutlookItemsEvents.FolderObj
member.summary: Returns the MAPIFolder object (a COM object) to the events of which the class is connected.
member.remarks:
Add-in Express relies on the state of the COM object provided in this class member. That's why you must never release it. On the contrary, you must release every COM object obtained from this COM object.
To release a COM object, you use the System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal.ReleaseComObject method.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXOutlookFoldersEvents
member.summary: Represents a set of business rules to be applied to the events of the Folders collection of a given Outlook folder and its sub-folders (optional).
member.remarks: The Folders collection is provided by the MAPIFolder class (also Folder in Outlook 2007+). It represents folders in the current folder and provides a number of events that occur when a folder is added to or removed from the collection. To use the ADXOutlookFoldersEvents class, you must add a descendant class to your add-in project (see the Add New Item dialog). To connect to the events of the Folders collection of a given folder, you create an instance of the descendant class, and invoke its ConnectTo method. This method accepts several parameters, one of which is of the MAPIFolder type. The other parameter specifies who will release the COM object corresponding to the folder. If it is set to true, the descendant class will release the COM object when disconnected from events. If the second parameter is false, the developer is responsible for releasing the COM object. There are overloaded variants of the ConnectTo method that allow connecting to the events of the Folders collection of all sub-folders of the specified folder. To disconnect from events, you invoke the RemoveConnection method of the descendant class.
