member.name: M:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXOutlookFoldersEvents.ConnectTo(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Connects to the events of the specified folder. If the eventClassReleasesComObject parameter is true, the folder object will be released when the RemoveConnection method of the class is called. Otherwise, the developer is responsible for releasing the folder object.
member.param: An Outlook folder the events of which will be processed by the class.

If true, the folder object will be released when the RemoveConnection method of the class is called. Otherwise, the developer is responsible for releasing the folder object specified in the olFolder parameter.
member.returns: Returns true, if the events are connected successfully. Otherwise, returns false.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXOutlookFoldersEvents.ConnectTo(System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Connects to the events of the specified folder. If the eventClassReleasesComObject parameter is true, the folder object will be released when the RemoveConnection method of the class is called. Otherwise, the developer is responsible for releasing the folder object.
member.param: An Outlook folder the events of which will be processed by the class.

If true, the folder object will be released when the RemoveConnection method of the class is called. Otherwise, the developer is responsible for releasing the folder object specified in the olFolder parameter.
If true, the class also connects to the events of the Items collections of all sub-folders of the specified folder.
member.returns: Returns true, if the events are connected successfully. Otherwise, returns false.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXOutlookItemEvents
member.summary: Represents a set of business rules to be applied to the events of an Outlook item.
member.remarks:
To use the ADXOutlookItemEvents class, you must add a descendant class to your add-in project (see the Add New Item dialog).
To connect to the events of a given Outlook item, you create an instance of the descendant class, and ivoke its ConnectTo method. This method accepts several parameters, one of which accepts the Outlook item. The other parameter specifies who will release the COM object corresponding to the Item. If it is set to true, the descendand class will release the COM object when disconnected from events. If the second parameter is false, the developer is responsible for releasing the COM object.
To disconnect from events, you invoke the RemoveConnection method of the descendant class.
To process events of the Item, you add your code to Process* methods of the descendant class. The methods are called when the corresponding events occur.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXExcelWorksheetEvents
member.summary: Represents a set of business rules to be applied to the events of the Worksheet and Chart classes in Excel.
member.remarks:
To use the ADXExcelWorksheetEvents class, you must add a descendant class to your add-in project (see the Add New Item dialog).
To connect to the events of a given Excel sheet, you create an instance of the descendant class, and ivoke its ConnectTo method. This method accepts several parameters, one of which accepts an object of the Excel.Worksheet type. The other parameter specifies who will release the COM object corresponding to the Items collection. If it is set to true, the descendand class will release the COM object when disconnected from events. If the second parameter is false, the developer is responsible for releasing the COM object.
To disconnect from events, you invoke the RemoveConnection method of the descendant class.
To process events of the Worksheet class , you add your code to Process* methods of the descendant class. The methods are called when the corresponding events occur.

member.summary: Connects to the events of the specified item. If the eventClassReleasesComObject parameter is true, the worksheet object will be released when the RemoveConnection method of the class is called. Otherwise, the developer is responsible for releasing the worksheet object.
member.param: An Excel worksheet the events of which will be processed by the class.

If true, the worksheet object will be released when the RemoveConnection method of the class is called. Otherwise, the developer is responsible for releasing the folder object specified in the xlWorksheet parameter.
member.returns: Returns true, if the events are connected successfully. Otherwise, returns false.

member.summary: Disconnects the class from the events of the object specified in the ConnectTo method. If specified in the ConnectTo method, releases the object.

Add-in Express relies on the state of the COM object provided in this class member. That's why you must never release it. On the contrary, you must release every COM object obtained from this COM object.
To release a COM object, you use the System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal.ReleaseComObject method.
member.param: The new selected Excel.Range object (a COM object).

member.summary: In Outlook 2000-2002, returns or sets the icon view displayed by the group. In Outlook 2003-2007, does not have any effect on the icons displayed in the Shortcuts pane (Outlook Bar).

member.summary: Returns a constant indicating the object's class.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXOlBarGroup.Session
member.summary: Returns the NameSpace object (a COM object) for the current session. If not connected, returns null (Nothing in VB).
member.remarks: You must release the COM object returned by this method using the Marshal.ReleaseComObject method.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXOlBarGroup.Collection
member.summary: The item's owner collection.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXOlBarGroup.IsConnected
member.summary: True if the current class instance is connected to the corresponding COM object provided by the host application.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXOlBarGroup.GroupObj
member.summary: Returns or sets the COM object connected to the current instance of the class.
member.remarks:
Add-in Express relies on the state of the COM object provided in this class member. That's why you must never release it. On the contrary, you must release every COM object obtained from this COM object.
To release a COM object, you use the ReleaseComObject method of the Marshal class located in the System.Runtime.InteropServices namespace.

member.summary: Returns or sets the display name of the shortcut.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXOlBarShortcut.Target
member.summary: Returns an Object (probably a COM object) indicating the target of the shortcut.
member.remarks: The return type depends on the shortcut type. If the shortcut represents a Microsoft Outlook folder, the return type is MAPIFolder (a COM object that you must release via Marshal.ReleaseComObject). If the shortcut represents a file-system folder, the return type is an Object (a COM object?). If the shortcut represents a file-system path or URL, the return type is a String.

member.summary: Returns a constant indicating the object's class. If isn't connected, returns zero.

member.summary: Returns a NameSpace object (a COM object) for the current session. If isn't connected, returns null (Nothing in VB).

member.name: E:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXOutlookAppEvents.CommandBarsUpdate
member.summary: Occurs when any change is made to a command bar.
member.remarks: The event is triggered by any change to a command bar or command bar control or any change to the state of a command bar or command bar control. These changes can occur due to a text or cell selection, for example. Since a large number of OnUpdate events can occur during normal usage, developers should exercise caution when using this event. It is strongly recommended that this event be used primarily for checking that a custom command bar has been added or removed by a COM add-in.

member.name: E:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXPowerPointAppEvents.CommandBarsUpdate
member.summary: Occurs when any change is made to a command bar.
member.remarks: The event is triggered by any change to a command bar or command bar control or any change to the state of a command bar or command bar control. These changes can occur due to a text or cell selection, for example. Since a large number of OnUpdate events can occur during normal usage, developers should exercise caution when using this event. It is strongly recommended that this event be used primarily for checking that a custom command bar has been added or removed by a COM add-in.

member.summary: Occurs after all records in a mail merge have merged successfully.

member.summary: Occurs after each record in the data source successfully merges in a mail merge.

member.name: E:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXPublisherAppEvents.MailMergeBeforeMerge
member.summary: Occurs when a merge is executed before any records in a mail merge have merged.

member.summary: Occurs as a merge is executed for the individual records in a merge.

member.summary: Occurs when the data source is loaded for a mail merge.

member.summary: Occurs when the custom button is clicked on step six of the Mail Merge Wizard.

member.summary: Occurs when a user changes from a specified step to a specified step in the Mail Merge Wizard.

member.summary: Occurs when a user performs address verification by clicking Validate in the Mail Merge Recipients dialog box.

member.name: E:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXPublisherAppEvents.MailMergeInsertBarcode
member.summary: Occurs when the user issues the command to insert postal barcodes into a mail-merge publication, either in the Microsoft Office Publisher user interface (UI), or programmatically.

member.name: E:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXPublisherAppEvents.MailMergeRecipientListClose
member.summary: Fires when the user closes the Mail Merge Recipients dialog box. (From the Mail Merge or E-mail Merge task pane, click Edit Recipient List). Also fires when the user closes the Catalog Merge Product List dialog box, which opens when the user clicks Edit Product List in the Catalog Merge task pane.

member.name: E:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXPublisherAppEvents.MailMergeGenerateBarcode
member.summary: Occurs when Microsoft Office Publisher requires data to generate barcodes in a mail-merge publication, in particular when the mail-merge recipient list changes.

member.name: E:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXPublisherAppEvents.MailMergeWizardFollowUpCustom
member.summary: Fires when the string that appears as the fourth item under Prepare to follow-up on this mailing on the third Mail Merge task pane in the Microsoft Office Publisher user interface is clicked.

member.name: E:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXPublisherAppEvents.BeforePrint
member.summary: Occurs before the publication is printed or previewed. This event fires only after the document fully loads and the onload events are returned. Printing does not occur until the event handler executes.

member.name: E:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXPublisherAppEvents.AfterPrint
member.summary: This event is fired after all variables and fields are printed. User interface control does not return to the user until the event handler is executed. The event is called after all the drawing operations are complete (in other words, after the software's job is complete and the printing hardware takes over).

member.summary: Fires when the catalog of publication wizards is displayed in the Microsoft Office Publisher user interface.

member.name: E:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXPublisherAppEvents.HideCatalogUI
member.summary: Occurs when the catalog of publication wizards is hidden in the Microsoft Office Publisher user interface.

member.name: E:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXWordAppEvents.CommandBarsUpdate
member.summary: Occurs when any change is made to a command bar.
member.remarks: The event is triggered by any change to a command bar or command bar control or any change to the state of a command bar or command bar control. These changes can occur due to a text or cell selection, for example. Since a large number of OnUpdate events can occur during normal usage, developers should exercise caution when using this event. It is strongly recommended that this event be used primarily for checking that a custom command bar has been added or removed by a COM add-in.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXXLLModule.HelpFile
member.summary: The path and file name of a CHM file providing help topics for the add-in.
member.remarks: This property combined with the ADXExcelFunctionDescriptor.HelpTopicId property creates a reference to the Help file (.chm or .hlp) to display when the user clicks the Help button (when your custom function is displayed). Can be in the form filepath!HelpTopicId or http://address/path_to_file_in_site!0. Both parts before and after the "!" are required. HelpTopicId must not contain single quotes, and will be converted by Excel to an unsigned integer 4 bytes long, in decimal form. When using the URL form, Excel opens only the referenced help file.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXKeyDownEventArgs
member.summary: Supplies datd for the ADXAddinModule.OnKeyDown event.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXKeyDownEventArgs.VirtualKey
member.summary: Specifies the virtual-key code of the key that generated the keystroke message.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXKeyDownEventArgs.KeystrokeFlags
member.summary: Specifies the repeat count, scan code, extended-key flag, context code, previous key-state flag, and transition-state flag.
member.remarks:
This parameter can be one or more of the following values.
0-15 Specifies the repeat count. The value is the number of times the keystroke is repeated as a result of the user's holding down the key.
16-23 Specifies the scan code. The value depends on the OEM.
24 Specifies whether the key is an extended key, such as a function key or a key on the numeric keypad. The value is 1 if the key is an extended key; otherwise, it is 0.
25-28 Reserved.
29 Specifies the context code. The value is 1 if the ALT key is down; otherwise, it is 0.
30 Specifies the previous key state. The value is 1 if the key is down before the message is sent; it is 0 if the key is up.
31 Specifies the transition state. The value is 0 if the key is being pressed and 1 if it is being released.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXKeyDownEventArgs.Ctrl
member.summary: Returns true, if Ctrl is pressed.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXKeyDownEventArgs.Shift
member.summary: Returns true, if Shift is pressed.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXKeyDownEventArgs.Handled
member.summary: Specifies if the keystroke message was processed by the developer.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.MSO.ADXProjectBeforeSaveBaseline_EventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that handles the ProjectBeforeSaveBaseline event in Project.
member.remarks: Add-in Express relies on the state of the COM objects provided in this class member. That's why you must never release it. On the contrary, you must release every COM object obtained from this COM object.
member.param: The object that caused the event.
The project (a COM object) displayed in the window.
True if saving an interim baseline. False if saving a full baseline.

The baseline you are saving. Can be one of the following PjBaselines constants: pjBaseline, pjBaseline1, pjBaseline2, pjBaseline3, pjBaseline4, pjBaseline5, pjBaseline6, pjBaseline7, pjBaseline8, pjBaseline9, or pjBaseline10.

The interim plan being copied from. Can be one of the following PjSaveBaselineFrom constants: pjCopyBaseline, pjCopyBaseline1, pjCopyBaseline2, pjCopyBaseline3, pjCopyBaseline4, pjCopyBaseline5, pjCopyBaseline6, pjCopyBaseline7, pjCopyBaseline8, pjCopyBaseline9, pjCopyBaseline10, pjCopyCurrent, pjCopyStart_Finish1, pjCopyStart_Finish2, pjCopyStart_Finish3, pjCopyStart_Finish4, pjCopyStart_Finish5, pjCopyStart_Finish6, pjCopyStart_Finish7, pjCopyStart_Finish8, pjCopyStart_Finish9, or pjCopyStart_Finish10.

The interim plan to which you are saving. Can be one of the following PjSaveBaselineTo constants: pjIntoBaseline, pjIntoBaseline1, pjIntoBaseline2, pjIntoBaseline3, pjIntoBaseline4, pjIntoBaseline5, pjIntoBaseline6, pjIntoBaseline7, pjIntoBaseline8, pjIntoBaseline9, pjIntoBaseline10, pjIntoStart_Finish1, pjIntoStart_Finish2, pjIntoStart_Finish3, pjIntoStart_Finish4, pjIntoStart_Finish5, pjIntoStart_Finish6, pjIntoStart_Finish7, pjIntoStart_Finish8, pjIntoStart_Finish9, or pjIntoStart_Finish10.
True if saving the entire project.
True if you wish to roll up baselines to summary tasks.
True if you wish to roll up baselines from subtasks.
An EventInfo (a COM object). EventInfo.Cancel is False when the event occurs. If the event procedure sets this argument to True, the baseline is not saved.
